MESSAGE: selling a 2009 chevy impala#137k miles#im the second owner. clean tile.#selling because i live in the city; and decided to get my motorcycle license.#asking $2700. its a great car; but it does have a couple issues so i knocked the price down from kelly blue book; which is $3850.#it has a brand new battery with a 2 year warranty through firestone (ill give you the paperwork for that).#the tires are great as is the alignment. ive never once had a single issue with anything engine related. its always driven flawlessly.#issues:#-actuator needs to be replaced. spoke to firestone on howell mill; and they said itd be a relatively simple procedure; about $125-150.#-low beam lights are out. im assuming its a fuse; which you can probably get from advanced auto parts pretty cheap; and theyll usually install it for you for free.#-missing passenger side mirror; you can get it for $100-150 as well. i still have the actual mirror if that helps.#-theres a small indention just below the drivers side door handle where someone tried to break in. i dont know the cost of that; but a quick google search shows you can replace the door handle for as low as $100.#-some cosmetic damage on the back drivers side. everything functions just fine.#i havent fixed all of the issues because frankly; i want a motorcycle and i dont have time to take it to the shop or do the repairs myself.#the car is 8 years old; under 150k miles - this car still has a lot of years/miles left. whether you just need a lower cost fixer-up; or maybe a first car; this is a really good option.#cash only please. and no; i do not need help selling my car. thanks!
